column1: #Text=I think the Globe and Mail should concentrate on what Trump's victory means for the Globe and Mail.
#Text=I have never seen a paper give such poor coverage to a political candidate.
#Text=For the last year, it has been nothing but ridicule, dismissiveness, and a foregone conclusion that he would be defeated.
#Text=In doing so, this paper has misled the reader and we now are in a position of knowing nothing about the new President.
#Text=This paper failed in its fundamental responsibility of reporting the truth.
#Text=It has been a year of propaganda from nearly every reporter covering the American election as well as from the editors.
#Text=As a subscriber of this epaper, I feel a certain sense of betrayal of the G&M's overlooking the truth.
#Text=Factual reporting sacrificed to make a political point.
#Text=Shame on this paper and those who work for it.
